title: Sarong Fragment, 19th century
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave
description: Portion of a sarong with pattern of birds and flowers in pale red and two shades of blue on yellow ochre ground in the the body or 'badan'. Somewhat similar pattern in larger scale is printed in the same colors on the the head or 'kepala', a wide strip dyed black over the base ochre color. Batiked and patterned on one side only.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sarong Fragment, 19th century.
19th century. Medium: cotton
Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave. Gift of Harvey Smith. 1968-135-95.
